level.text: 2313.1 Upon application by a licensee and payment of the required fee, theoard shall place a licensee on inactive status.
2313.2 The Board shall issue a license to an individual who is on inactivetatus and who desires to resume practice as a real estate appraiser if thendividual meets the following requirements:
Demonstrates completion of all continuing education that would have beenequired had the individual been on active status; and
Applies for license renewal within five (5) years of going on inactivetatus.
2313.3 The Board may take disciplinary action against a licensee on inactivetatus.
2313.4 A licensee may remain on inactive status for a period not to exceed five5) consecutive years.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 40 DCR 8480 (December 10, 1993); asmended by Final Rulemaking published at 53 DCR 5846 (July 21, 2006); as amendedy Notice of Final Rulemaking published at 58 DCR 10590, 10598 (December 16,011).
